title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2053.10 - Denial of request for a record or amendment or correction of a record or personal information
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2053.10 - Denial of request for a record or amendment or correction of a record or personal information

State Regulations
(a) Any
denial of a request for records or denial of a request for amendment or
correction of a record or personal information shall be in writing and shall: (1)
explain the reasons therefor; and
(2)
identify the person and
business address to whom an appeal may be directed and explain the appeal
procedure. (b) A failure
to grant or deny access to records within five business days of the receipt of
a request for access or within 30 days of an acknowledgment of the receipt of a
request for access, or a failure to respond to a request for amendment or
correction of a record within 30 business days of receipt of such a request, shall be construed as a denial that may be appealed. (c) Any such denial may be appealed to the

President, United Nations Development Corporation, Two United Nations Plaza, New York, NY. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
2053.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
